intro: Parosela lagopus, commonly known as the snow buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow flowers and palmate leaves. The plant thrives in cold, high-altitude environments, often growing in rocky soils and meadows. Its flowers are typically borne on short stalks and bloom in late spring to early summer. Parosela lagopus is adapted to harsh climates, with a short growing season and specialized structures to conserve heat and moisture.
